subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... I prefer neither. I name the exception variable expected and that s comment enough. Also, don t forget to invoke fail() at the end of your try block,
messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:
> Someone in our team writes his tests like this:
>
> try
> {
> articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
> }
> catch(NoObjectFoundException e)
> {
> assertTrue(true);
> }
>
> He says the does it because otherwise Checkstyle would complain about
> the empty catch block.
>
> I do it in this manner:
>
> try
> {
> articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
> }
> catch(NoObjectFoundException e)
> {
> // Its okay since we expect it.
> }
>
> What do you prefer in the case above: assertTrue(true) or inline
> comment in the catch block?

I prefer neither. I name the exception variable "expected" and that's
comment enough.

Also, don't forget to invoke fail() at the end of your try block,
otherwise the tests /passes/ when findArticleById() doesn't throw an
exception.
